Question: Which of the following statements about Java is incorrect?
Option 1: Omitting a break statement at the end of a case in a switch statement will lead to code "falling through" to the next case.
Option 2: Classes are used as namespaces in Java programs.
Option 3: A class that implements an interface may only define methods that are declared in the interface.

Question: In the absence of locks, what does it mean for a procedure to be "atomic"?
Option 1: The procedure can be used as a key in a HashMap.
Option 2: The procedure involves only one line of Java code.
Option 3: The procedure involves only one line of Java code AND does not call any library functions.
